alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Sussex County through 630 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laurel, or 12 miles north of Salisbury, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Seaford, Millsboro, Laurel, Selbyville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Millville, Gumboro, Sycamore, Long Neck, Ocean View, Blades, Frankford, South Bethany, Dewey Beach and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
